reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my girlfriend back in February of 2009. It is by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. If the weather had been warmer outside, I would've preferred to sleep on the side streets. I chose the hotel mainly due to price and location. The room was dirty, the staircase could barely fit our suitcases, and the room wasn't even level. I know it's hard to believe, but the entire floor was inclined. My girlfriend and I dreaded coming back to the hotel. We would basically leave in the morning and go back only when we "had to" only to sleep. Do yourself a favor, and either pay a little more or stay a little further out in the city. The public transportation in Paris is extremely efficient so getting around is not a problem. Don't let a hotel ruin your vacation.
reviews.title: Location is worth only so much

reviews.text: I stayed here between 8-11 of September 2009. Whatever you do: don´t let the scottish side of you, fool you into checkin´ in here! The rooms are extremely small, completely charmless and dirty. It smells of pee and damp and what´s even worse: some of the personnel are extremely rude and unfriendly (this does not apply to the young student´s working extra in the evening). On the day of your departure they practically throw you out. Check out time is 11.00, but already at eight they start tapping at your door with a coin and this goes on for the next hours. I´ve stayed here several times against better judgement but now I´m through with this awful place. There are much better budget options in Paris. It may be that you´ll have to pay a few euros more but it´s worth every penny, trust me!
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although this hotel is close to one of the main attractions in Paris, location is not everything. I would take quality over quantity any day, esp. when it comes to renting a room for the night. Cheaper hotel room to rent, but not that cheap! I have never seen a dirtier hotel room than this one. The bathroom was small, shower faucet was broken, and dirty pillows with no pillow cases, not to mention the torn bed linen. My husband and I were actually afraid to sleep under the bed linen. This is by far the worst hotel experience in my life. I would NEVER stay here again and would NEVER recommend this hotel to my friends or family.
reviews.title: WORST HOTEL OF THE TRIP

reviews.text: We are a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 children) and we were given 1 big room with washroom. The room was ok; we were out most of the time anyway. The staff was really friendly and helpful, especially Ahmelle, the lady at the reception counter. Location is fantastic; 5 mins walk to the Louvre. Very reasonably priced, esp. if you do not want to pay so much for accommodation. Basically, you get what you pay for!
reviews.title: You get what you pay for

reviews.text: This place is really a dump with a great location. Run down, no phones in the room, very dirty and really in need of rennovation. The upside? The only place in the 1st Arrondisement that's under $400 a night. It was great to be able to walk everywhere but be forewarned ...
reviews.title: More Hostel than Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my wife and I have spent a week in the hotel de rouen in june and have really enjoyed it.  The location is perfect, just in the heart of Paris. It is a quiet place near the Louvre and the beautiful gardens « les Tuileries ». The prices are not expensive, we can stay one week for the price of 4 days in an other place.  the receptionists working there are very kind, they just want you to have a good trip in Paris. The rooms have just been redecorated, it is quite simple but all you need is there. We availed ourself of the shuttle they propose to go to the airport and it is very easy. It’s a very good buy place to enjoy a stay in Paris
reviews.title: exactly what we expected

reviews.text: Armele and Evelyne are the best.
reviews.title: Fabulous little secret

reviews.text: This hotel is not a hotel "a far niente".
reviews.title: I'd stay there again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the best location, a low price and very nice staff.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE
Value?
reviews.text: Rooms are very basic, everything is basic, but that is what this hotel is all about.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel de Rouen is extremely well located in Paris, just a few minutes from the Louvre, Centre Pompidou and from Metro stations, the street is quiet and you may find lots of services near (drugstore,restaurants, convenience stores, gift shops, bars, etc.)
reviews.title: Very friendly staff, unexpensive hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very small, but the place is clean and the heating works perfectly (I stayed there last March and the weather was rainy and very cold) . The staff is extremely helpful and friendly, and above all the price is very convenient, I had previously stayed at a similar hotel near and payed double of the price for a room just like the one I got a Rouen's, I would definetely reccomend this hotel to a friend.
reviews.title: Awful and dirty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is awful, it can't be even considered an hotel! It is a steep and narrow stair with old curtains stitched to the walls and the rooms. Our room was on the first floor. It was small but this was not a problem. The real problem was that it was really dirty and noisy, the carpet was shabby, the ceiling was mouldy, the walls were full of stains, the bed was absolutely unconfortable with a tiny old mattress and no pillows. The bathroom was in bad conditions. They change towels each day but they give you two towels, like handkerchief! We asked for two more. Only a lady of the staff is friendly. The cleaning lady woke us up very early in the morning because she wanted to clean the room! I was astonished and said her to wait at least the time to dress and she answered " Right now or never". I went back to bed! She disturbed us again later and we let the rom free but when we came back in the evening the room was not clean. They NEVER clean the room and do the bed.
reviews.title: low quality, but friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only positive thing is that is in a incredible position.
reviews.title: Budget hote. I will stay here again.

likes.liked: — It was very clean and cosy

reviews.text: The price giustifies the fact that the hotel is basic but not so dirty and unconfortable. Our suggestion is to pay more and stay in a nicer ad more confortable room.
reviews.title: Budget hotel..though quality left room to be improved

reviews.text: I wasn't expecting the Ritz for 55 euros a night 2 blocks from the Louvre, but this little hotel surprised me with the warmth of the reception, the fast free internet, and overall satisfaction. For a cheap place to stay, you can't do better in Paris. Yes it's tiny and the beds are hard - wouldn't want to stay here for a week - but totally adequate and cheaper than most hostels.
reviews.title: No frills but Awesome Value in a Great Location!

reviews.text: If you want 5 * hotel luxury you will not like it =)
reviews.title: Great location, cheap, very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But if you just want a clean place to sleep for a budget this is the place.
reviews.title: Excellent location, wonderful staff and great price

reviews.text: We stayed in this place with my mother.
reviews.title: Newly renovated and fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, we nearly always walked everywhere we needed (however we like walking).
reviews.title: great location
